description: Smallest palindromic prime using n distinct n digits, or 0 if no such number exists.
mathematica: Do[ k = 10^n; While[ ! PrimeQ[ k*10^n + FromDigits[ Take[ Reverse[ RealDigits[ k ][ [ 1 ] ] ], {2, -1} ] ] ], k++ ]; Print[ k*10^n + FromDigits[ Take[ Reverse[ RealDigits[ k ][ [ 1 ] ] ], {2, -1} ] ] ]; If[ n == 0, Print[ 11 ], Print[ 0 ] ], {n, 0, 12} ]
crossrefs: Odd-numbered terms form A028989. - _Edward Catmur_, May 01 2015
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 11 2000
